name: NPR
text:
James Hamblin hasn't showered in five years — and he's tired of being asked if he's smelly.

The physician and health reporter details the benefits and social dynamics of showering less in his new book, "Clean." https://t.co/Zl5EL1MLRE

name: NPR
text:
"Hench," the first novel from Natalie Zina Walschots, is an engrossing take on the superheroic.

The story examines what happens when the ability to calculate the human cost of disaster is coupled with a superhuman ability to organize and manipulate data. https://t.co/vpjBpmvVVh

name: NPR
text: Some two dozen states saw new COVID-19 cases continue to rise this past week, pushing the total number of U.S. cases to more than 7 million. https://t.co/MP2mCcRl2d

name: NPR
text: Weeks after a heatwave intensified devastating wildfires burning throughout California, crews are bracing for weekend weather conditions expected to hamper containment efforts. https://t.co/HiEtdNHDB8

name: NPR
text: President Trump’s extension of an existing offshore drilling moratorium in the Gulf of Mexico stands in contrast to his administration's record of supporting oil and gas production and rolling back rules on greenhouse gas emissions. https://t.co/QBf7UPSdsE
